title: Got black screened at Champ Select. What do I do?

replies.body:
Seconded, although I simply get kicked out of queue over and over; whatever they were trying
to accomplish by making a new client when this is what we get is beyond me. 
Yes, I read all the flowery blubbergush, but fact is the
game hates the new client and the smallest tweak seems to have the potential to make it all unplayable!
From day one, it's been inferior in any and all ways from what we had before.

Hate to rant but this really just came to a head for me.

Getting kicked out of queue is different than the black screen, and sounds like a connection problem.  It's likely that you'll also get kicked out if you try the legacy client as well, in this case.  

-  On the login screen of the open beta updated client, look for the "Launch Legacy Client" text at the bottom.
-  Or create a shortcut directly to the legacy client in your League Installation. Just look for "lol.launcher" 

If that's the case for you, run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide and test it out in a custom game to prevent penalties.  Hope it helps!

There is a black screen bug currently specifically with champion select that we're currently investigating.  We aren't able to remove a queue dodge, but are requesting logs to investigate further.  If you've installed League in the default directory, you can find the log files by following this path:  

**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\LeagueClient Logs\**

In that folder, you'll want to provide the following log file types:
>* LeagueClient.log
* LeagueClientUx.log

Attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can investigate.

In the meantime, collapsing your friends list groups before queuing for a match, may serve as a temporary workaround. Here's a screenshot showing what that looks like:

https://i.imgur.com/wMLOFya.png

Let me know if you have any questions on this.
